Title: Query Example
DescriptionLines: This demo is an example of a
**Query with Combined Features**.
The query results will be:
5 (or less) projected EmployeeDetails entities that match the filtering criteria, ordered by descending hiring dates.
The following features are used in this example:
* Filtering data
* Including a related document
* Getting query statistics
* Sorting query results
* Projecting query results
* Limiting the number of results

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query on the 'Employees' collection Using the Session Query() LINQ method syntax.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a filtering condition
DescriptionLines: *  Query for documents from the Employees collection that match the following criteria:
* Employee's first name is 'Steven' -or-
* Employee's title is 'Sales Representative'
* Only the matching documents will be returned by the server.

Walkthroughs.Title: Include related documents
DescriptionLines: * Use `Include()` to instruct the server to send the related document, whose ID is in the 'ReportsTo' field, to the client.
* The related document will be added to the Session's internal entities map for tracking changes.

Walkthroughs.Title: Get query statistics
DescriptionLines: * When the query returns, the 'statistics' variable will contain information such as:
query duration, total number of results, staleness state of results, the tag of a cluster node which responded to the query, etc.

Walkthroughs.Title: Sort query results
DescriptionLines: * Results will be sorted according to field 'HiredAt', in descending order.

Walkthroughs.Title: Project query results
DescriptionLines: * Use `Select()` to retrieve only specific document fields from the server instead of the full 'Employee' document.
* The entities returned by the query will have the structure of the custom class 'EmployeeDetails'.
* The output projected 'EmployeeDetails' entities returned by the query are Not tracked by the Session, as they are Not full documents.
* Note the usage of `RavenQuery.Load()` in order to retrieve data from a related document within the projection definition.

Walkthroughs.Title: Limit number of results
DescriptionLines: * Use `Take()` to limit the number of results that are returned from the server.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: * The 'queryResults' variable will hold the resulting 5 matching 'EmployeeDetails' entities, ordered by 'HiredAt' field value.
* The output projected entities returned by the query are Not tracked by the Session, as they are not full documents.
Note: The included document (from the 'ReportsTo' field is loaded to the session for tracking.
